Literature Review: Sharp interface methods have emerged as a crucial tool for simulating and analyzing free surface flows with hydrodynamic singularities, such as drop/bubble breakup and coalescence, and film/sheet rupture. These methods have been instrumental in capturing the complex dynamics of these phenomena, which involve multiscale length scales and require high-resolution simulations to accurately model the behavior of fluids at the micro- and nano-scale. In this review, we will discuss the key findings and advancements in the field of sharp interface methods for simulating free surface flows with singularities, with a focus on drop breakup and coalescence, and film/sheet rupture.
